titleStmt.title: His Maiesties speech at Leicester, to the gentlemen, freeholders, and inhabitants of that county.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Imprinted at Yorke, and re-printed at London :

notesStmt.note: Royal arms with initials at head of title.

He had come to Leicester to remove any misunderstandings there. He has sent such propositions for peace and accommodation to Parliament as should make them submit. If they do not the King relies on them to support him and the old-established laws .. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
